name: microsoft_teams
description: Microsoft Teams integrates chat, video meetings, and file storage within Microsoft 365, providing virtual collaboration and communication for distributed teams

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_ADD_MEMBER_TO_TEAM
tools.description: Tool to add a user to a Microsoft Teams team. Use when granting or updating membership for a user.

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: Roles to assign to the member. Only 'owner' is supported. Omit or leave empty to add as a standard member.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The unique ID (GUID) of the Microsoft Team to which the member will be added.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's Graph ID (GUID) or userPrincipalName (email) to add to the team.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_ARCHIVE_TEAM
tools.description: Tool to archive a Microsoft Teams team. Use after confirming the team ID; returns 202 if accepted.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The Microsoft Teams team GUID to archive.

should_set_spo_site_read_only_for_member.title: Should Set Spo Site Read Only For Members
should_set_spo_site_read_only_for_member.description: If true, sets the SharePoint site to read-only for team members when archiving.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_CHATS_GET_ALL_CHATS
tools.description: Retrieves all Microsoft Teams chats a specified user is part of, supporting filtering, property selection, and pagination.

top.title: Top
top.description: The maximum number of chats to retrieve in a single API call, used for pagination. Default is 50. Microsoft Graph enforces a maximum limit of 50 per request.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: An OData filter query string to apply to the chat list (e.g., "topic eq 'Project Updates'"). Do not include '$filter=' in the string. This enables retrieving chats that match specific criteria.

select.title: Select
select.description: A list of specific Microsoft Graph chat resource properties to retrieve (e.g., 'id', 'topic'). If omitted or empty, a default set of properties is returned. Each string in the list should be a valid property name.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID or user principal name (UPN) of the user whose chats are to be retrieved. Use 'me' to specify the currently authenticated user.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_CHATS_GET_ALL_MESSAGES
tools.description: Retrieves all messages from a specified Microsoft Teams chat using the Microsoft Graph API, automatically handling pagination; ensure `chat_id` is valid and OData expressions in `filter` or `select` are correct.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of messages to retrieve per page. Used for pagination. Microsoft Graph enforces a maximum limit of 50 per request.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData v4.0 filter query string for messages. If empty, no filtering is applied.

chat_id.title: Chat Id
chat_id.description: Unique identifier of the Microsoft Teams chat.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_CREATE_MEETING
tools.description: Use to schedule a new standalone Microsoft Teams online meeting, i.e., one not linked to any calendar event.

inputSchema.title: CreateMeetingRequest

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: The subject or title for the online meeting.

items.title: OnlineMeetingParticipant

role.title: Role
role.description: Specifies the role of the participant in the meeting. Defaults to 'attendee'. Allowed values are 'attendee', 'presenter', or 'coorganizer'.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier (GUID) of the Microsoft Teams user to be added as a participant.

items.description: Specifies a participant's identity (user ID) and role for a Microsoft Teams online meeting.

participants.title: Participants
participants.description: An optional list of participants to invite to the meeting. Each participant is defined by their user ID and role.

end_date_time.title: End Date Time
end_date_time.description: The end date and time of the meeting, specified in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-08-15T11:00:00Z'). Must be after start_date_time.

start_date_time.title: Start Date Time
start_date_time.description: The start date and time of the meeting, specified in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-08-15T10:00:00Z').

is_passcode_required.title: Is Passcode Required
is_passcode_required.description: An optional boolean indicating whether a passcode should be required to join this meeting. If not specified, the organization's default policy applies.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new Microsoft Teams online meeting.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_CREATE_TEAM
tools.description: Tool to create a new Microsoft Teams team. Use when you need to provision a team with optional template, channels, and members.

inputSchema.title: CreateTeamRequest

items.title: Member

odata_type.title: Odata Type
odata_type.description: Resource type for conversation member; must be '#microsoft.graph.aadUserConversationMember'.

user_odata_bind.title: User Odata Bind
user_odata_bind.description: URL to the user resource, e.g. https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users('{id}').

items.description: Defines a conversation member to add to the new team.

members.title: Members
members.description: List of initial team members. At least one member with 'owner' role is recommended. If not provided, the authenticated user will be added as owner. Each member must specify '@odata.type', roles, and 'user@odata.bind'.

visibility.title: Visibility
visibility.description: Team visibility setting. 'private': Only owners can add members. 'public': Anyone in the organization can join. Default is 'public'.

description.title: Description
examples: Customer support team for EMEA region
description.description: Brief description of the team's purpose. Maximum 1024 characters. Note: Known template IDs for team creation: 'standard' (default), 'educationClass', 'educationStaff', 'educationProfessionalLearningCommunity'.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: Display name of the team as it will appear in Microsoft Teams. Must be unique within the organization.

firstChannelName.title: First Channel Name
firstChannelName.description: Name of the first channel created; defaults to 'General' if omitted.

template_odata_bind.title: Template Odata Bind
template_odata_bind.description: URL reference to the team template. Common templates: 'standard' (default), 'educationClass', 'educationStaff', 'educationProfessionalLearningCommunity'. Format: https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/teamsTemplates('template-id')

inputSchema.description: Request payload to create a new Microsoft Teams team.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_DELETE_TEAM
tools.description: Tool to delete a Microsoft Teams team. Use after confirming the target team ID.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The unique identifier (GUID) of the Microsoft Teams team to delete.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_GET_CHANNEL
tools.description: Tool to get a specific channel in a team. Use after obtaining valid team and channel IDs to fetch channel details.

inputSchema.title: GetChannelRequest

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The unique identifier of the Microsoft Teams team.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The unique identifier of the channel within the specified team.

inputSchema.description: Parameters for retrieving a specific channel in a team.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_GET_CHAT_MESSAGE
tools.description: Tool to get a specific chat message. Use after confirming chat_id and message_id.

chat_id.title: Chat Id
chat_id.description: Unique identifier of the Microsoft Teams chat that contains the message.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Unique identifier of the chat message to retrieve.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_GET_TEAM
tools.description: Tool to get a specific team. Use when full details of one team by ID are needed.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: GUID of the Microsoft Teams team to retrieve.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_LIST_MESSAGE_REPLIES
tools.description: Tool to list replies to a channel message. Use after obtaining team, channel, and message IDs.

inputSchema.title: ListMessageRepliesRequest

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of replies to return per page (1-50).

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: Unique identifier (GUID) of the Microsoft Teams team.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: Unique identifier of the channel within the team.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Unique identifier of the channel message whose replies are to be listed.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for listing replies to a channel message.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_LIST_TEAM_MEMBERS
tools.description: Tool to list members of a Microsoft Teams team. Use when you need to retrieve the members of a specific team, for auditing or notifications.

inputSchema.title: ListTeamMembersRequest

top.title: Top
top.description: Optional maximum number of members to return (1–999).

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: GUID of the Microsoft Teams team to retrieve members from.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for listing members of a Microsoft Teams team.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_LIST_TEAMS_TEMPLATES
tools.description: Tool to list available Microsoft Teams templates. Use when retrieving templates for team creation or customization workflows.

inputSchema.title: GetTeamsTemplatesRequest

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of templates to return (1–999).

skip.title: Skip
skip.description: Number of templates to skip for pagination.

count.title: Count
count.description: If true, include a count of total matching templates in the response.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData filter expression to filter the templates (e.g., "startsWith(displayName,'Template')").

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated template properties to include in the response (e.g., 'id,displayName,description'). If empty, default properties are returned.

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: Comma-separated properties and directions to order the results by (e.g., 'displayName desc').

inputSchema.description: Request schema for listing available Microsoft Teams templates using OData query parameters.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_LIST_USERS
tools.description: Tool to list all users in the organization. Use when you need to retrieve directory users with filtering, pagination, and field selection.

inputSchema.title: ListUsersRequest

$top.title: $Top
$top.description: Maximum number of users to return per page (1-999).

$skip.title: $Skip
$skip.description: Number of users to skip for pagination.

$filter.title: $Filter
$filter.description: OData filter to refine results by property values (e.g., `startswith(displayName,'A')`).

$select.title: $Select
$select.description: Comma-separated list of user properties to include (e.g., `id,displayName,mail`).

$orderby.title: $Orderby
$orderby.description: OData orderby clause to sort results (e.g., `displayName desc`).

consistencyLevel.title: Consistency Level
consistencyLevel.description: Set to 'eventual' when using advanced queries with $count.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for listing users in the organization via Microsoft Graph API.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_SEARCH_FILES
tools.description: Search files in Microsoft Teams using KQL syntax. Find files by name, type, content, author, and modification date across all Teams and channels. Supports boolean logic and date ranges. Examples: 'filetype:pdf AND lastmodifiedtime>=2024-10-01', 'contract AND budget', 'filename:report AND author:user@example.com'

inputSchema.title: SearchTeamsFilesRequest

size.title: Size
size.description: The maximum number of file results to return per page. Use with from_index for pagination.

query.title: Query
query.description:
Search query for files in Teams. Supports keywords, filenames, and content search.

**Basic Syntax:**
- Keywords: 'budget contract'
- Exact phrases: '"project timeline"'
- Filenames: 'report.pdf' or 'filename:contract'
- File types: 'filetype:pdf' or 'filetype:docx'
- Boolean: 'contract AND budget' or 'report OR summary'

**Property Filters:**
- filename: File name - 'filename:contract'
- filetype: File extension - 'filetype:pdf', 'filetype:docx', 'filetype:xlsx'
- author: Creator - 'author:user@example.com'
- lastmodifiedtime: Modified date - 'lastmodifiedtime>=2024-10-01'

**Date Filters:**
- Exact: 'lastmodifiedtime:2024-10-01'
- Greater/equal: 'lastmodifiedtime>=2024-10-01'
- Range: 'lastmodifiedtime:2024-10-01..2024-10-31'
- Relative: 'lastmodifiedtime>today-30'

**Complex Queries:**
- 'contract AND filetype:pdf AND lastmodifiedtime>=2024-10-01'
- '(budget OR financial) AND filetype:xlsx'
- 'filename:report AND lastmodifiedtime>today-7'

from_index.title: From Index
from_index.description: The 0-based starting index for pagination. To paginate: check response['value'][0]['hitsContainers'][0]['moreResultsAvailable']. If true, call again with from_index += size (e.g., 0 → 25 → 50).

enable_top_results.title: Enable Top Results
enable_top_results.description: If `true`, sorts results by relevance; otherwise, sorts by date modified in descending order (newest first).

inputSchema.description: Searches files in Microsoft Teams using the Microsoft Search API.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_SEARCH_MESSAGES
tools.description: Search Microsoft Teams messages using powerful KQL syntax. Supports sender (from:), date filters (sent:), attachments, and boolean logic. Works across all Teams chats and channels the user has access to. Examples: 'from:user@example.com AND sent>=2024-10-01', 'punchlist OR termination', 'sent>today-30 AND hasattachment:yes'

inputSchema.title: SearchTeamsMessagesRequest

size.title: Size
size.description: The maximum number of search results to return per page. Use with from_index for pagination.

query.title: Query
query.description:
KQL (Keyword Query Language) search query string. Supports advanced syntax for precise searches.

**Basic Syntax:**
- Simple keywords: 'budget report'
- Exact phrases: '"quarterly review"'
- Boolean operators: 'urgent AND deadline' or 'invoice OR receipt'

**Property Filters (prefix:value):**
- from: Sender - 'from:user@example.com' or 'from:example.com'
- sent: Date sent - 'sent:2024-10-01' or 'sent>=2024-10-01'
- hasattachment: Has files - 'hasattachment:yes' or 'hasattachment:no'

**Date Operators:**
- Exact: 'sent:2024-10-01'
- Greater/equal: 'sent>=2024-10-01'
- Less/equal: 'sent<=2024-10-31'
- Range: 'sent:2024-10-01..2024-10-31'
- Relative: 'sent>today-7' (last 7 days)

**Combining Filters:**
- AND: 'from:user@example.com AND subject:budget'
- OR: 'punchlist OR termination'
- Complex: '(punchlist OR termination) AND sent>=2024-10-01'

Note: Can be empty to return recent messages.

from_index.title: From Index
from_index.description: The 0-based starting index for pagination. To paginate: check response['value'][0]['hitsContainers'][0]['moreResultsAvailable']. If true, call again with from_index += size (e.g., 0 → 25 → 50). Message ID is in hits[]['hitId'], not hits[]['resource']['id'].

enable_top_results.title: Enable Top Results
enable_top_results.description: If `true`, sorts results by relevance; otherwise, sorts by date in descending order (newest first).

inputSchema.description: Searches Microsoft Teams messages using the Microsoft Search API.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_CREATE_CHANNEL
tools.description: Creates a new 'standard', 'private', or 'shared' channel within a specified Microsoft Teams team.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name for the new channel. Maximum length is 50 characters. Cannot contain characters ~ # % & * { } + / \ : < > ? | ' " or start with an underscore or period, or end with a period.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The GUID of the existing Microsoft Teams team where the new channel will be created.

description.title: Description
examples: Channel for all discussions related to Project Alpha.
Strategic planning for the fourth quarter.
description.description: An optional, user-friendly description of the channel's purpose. Maximum length is 1024 characters.

membership_type.title: Membership Type
membership_type.description: Membership type determining channel accessibility: 'standard' is accessible to all team members, 'private' is only accessible to a specific subset of team members, and 'shared' can be shared with people outside the team or organization (requires appropriate policies).

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_CREATE_CHAT
tools.description: Creates a new chat; if a 'oneOnOne' chat with the specified members already exists, its details are returned, while 'group' chats are always newly created.

inputSchema.title: CreateChatRequest

topic.title: Topic
topic.description: Subject or title for the chat. REQUIRED for group chats. For 'oneOnOne' chats, this field is ignored and should be omitted.

items.title: AADUserConversationMemberRequest

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: Roles for this member. Group chats require at least one 'owner'.

tenantId.title: Tenant Id
tenantId.description: Azure AD tenant ID of the user, required if the user is an external guest.

odata_type.title: Odata Type
odata_type.description: Identifies the object as an Azure AD user conversation member.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: Display name of the conversation member, shown in the Teams UI.

user_odata_bind.title: User Odata Bind
user_odata_bind.description: Binding URL for the user resource in Microsoft Graph. This field is automatically mapped to 'user@odata.bind' format required by the API.

visibleHistoryStartDateTime.title: Visible History Start Date Time
visibleHistoryStartDateTime.description: ISO 8601 timestamp determining how far back the member can view chat history; defaults to when they were added.

items.description: Specifies an Azure AD user to be added as a member to a chat.

members.title: Members
members.description: List of members. For 'oneOnOne' chats, exactly two members are required. For 'group' chats, at least two members are required and at least one member must have the 'owner' role.

chatType.title: Chat Type
chatType.description: Type of chat. If 'oneOnOne' for members with an existing chat, that chat's details are returned.

inputSchema.description: Request payload for creating a new Microsoft Teams chat.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_GET_MESSAGE
tools.description: Retrieves a specific message from a Microsoft Teams channel using its Team, Channel, and Message IDs.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: ID of the Team containing the channel where the message is located.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: ID of the Channel within the specified Team that contains the message.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: ID of the message to retrieve from the channel.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_LIST
tools.description: Retrieves Microsoft Teams accessible by the authenticated user, allowing filtering, property selection, and pagination.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of teams to return per page (1-999). Used for pagination; see `next_link` in response.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData v4.0 filter string to refine results based on team properties (e.g., `startsWith(displayName,'A')`). Consult OData v4.0 documentation for syntax.

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated team properties to retrieve (e.g., 'id,displayName,description'). If empty or omitted, standard properties are returned. Supported properties include `id`, `displayName`, `description`, `visibility`.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_LIST_CHANNELS
tools.description: Retrieves channels for a specified Microsoft Teams team ID (must be valid and for an existing team), with options to include shared channels, filter results, and select properties.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData v4 query string to filter channels (e.g., `startswith(displayName,'Sales')` or `membershipType eq 'private'`).

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated channel properties to return (e.g., 'id,displayName,description'); empty for default properties. Common: `id`, `displayName`, `description`, `email`, `membershipType`, `webUrl`.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the Microsoft Teams team.

include_shared_channels.title: Include Shared Channels
include_shared_channels.description: If true, include channels shared with the team.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_LIST_CHAT_MESSAGES
tools.description: Retrieves messages (newest first) from an existing and accessible Microsoft Teams one-on-one chat, group chat, or channel thread, specified by `chat_id`.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of messages to retrieve. Microsoft Graph enforces a maximum limit of 50 per request.

chat_id.title: Chat Id
chat_id.description: Unique Microsoft Graph chat identifier (GUID format). This is the chat ID returned by Graph API, not a channel thread ID. Use the Get All Chats action to retrieve valid chat IDs.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_LIST_PEOPLE
tools.description: Retrieves a list of people relevant to a specified user from Microsoft Graph, noting the `search` parameter is only effective if `user_id` is 'me'.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of items per page for pagination. Actual count may be less. Service default if unspecified.

skip.title: Skip
skip.description: Number of items to skip for pagination.

search.title: Search
search.description: Fuzzy search query (name, email, or topic like 'topic:marketing'). Effective only when `user_id` is 'me'.

select.title: Select
select.description: Comma-separated OData property names to include for each person (e.g., 'id,displayName'). If unspecified, a default set is returned. Note: 'emailAddresses' is not a valid property for microsoft.graph.person; use 'scoredEmailAddresses' instead.

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: OData $orderby expression to sort results (e.g., 'displayName asc, relevanceScore desc').

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Identifier of the user (e.g., 'me', 'adelev@contoso.com', or GUID) whose relevant people are to be retrieved.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_POST_CHANNEL_MESSAGE
tools.description: Posts a new text or HTML message to a specified channel in a Microsoft Teams team.

content.title: Content
content.description: The content of the message to be sent. Can be plain text or HTML, determined by `content_type`.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The unique identifier of the Microsoft Teams team containing the channel.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The unique identifier of the channel within the specified team where the message will be posted.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: The format of the message content. Supported values: 'text' (plain text) or 'html' (HTML content). Defaults to 'text'.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_POST_CHAT_MESSAGE
tools.description: Sends a non-empty message (text or HTML) to a specified, existing Microsoft Teams chat; content must be valid HTML if `content_type` is 'html'.

chat_id.title: Chat Id
chat_id.description: Unique identifier for the Microsoft Teams chat to receive the message.

content.title: Content
examples:
Hello

This is a test message with HTML.
content.description: Message content, either plain text or HTML (see `content_type`).

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_TEAMS_POST_MESSAGE_REPLY
tools.description: Sends a reply to an existing message, identified by `message_id`, within a specific `channel_id` of a given `team_id` in Microsoft Teams.

content.title: Content
examples: Sure, I will look into this.
content.description: The body of the reply message. This can be plain text or HTML, as specified by the `content_type` field.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The unique identifier (GUID) of the Microsoft Teams team that contains the channel where the message to be replied to exists.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The unique identifier of the channel within the specified team. This channel contains the message to which the reply will be posted. Channel IDs typically follow a format like '19:{alphanumeric_string}@thread.tacv2'.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The unique identifier of the specific message within the channel to which this reply is directed.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: Specifies the format of the `content` field. Accepted values are 'text' for plain text content and 'html' for content with HTML formatting. Defaults to 'text' if not provided.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_UNARCHIVE_TEAM
tools.description: Tool to unarchive a Microsoft Teams team. Use when you need to restore an archived team to active state.

inputSchema.title: UnarchiveTeamRequest

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The unique identifier (GUID) of the team to unarchive.

inputSchema.description: Request schema to unarchive a Microsoft Teams team.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_UPDATE_CHANNEL_MESSAGE
tools.description: Tool to update a message in a channel. Use when you need to modify an existing channel message after confirming channel and message IDs.

content.title: Content
content.description: Updated message content, either plain text or HTML.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: Unique identifier of the Microsoft Teams team.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: Unique identifier of the channel within the team.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Unique identifier of the channel message to update.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: Format of the message content: 'text' or 'html'.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_UPDATE_CHAT_MESSAGE
tools.description: Tool to update a specific message in a chat. Use when you need to correct or modify a sent chat message.

chat_id.title: Chat Id
chat_id.description: Unique identifier of the Microsoft Teams chat.

content.title: Content
examples: Updated the details of the meeting.
content.description: Updated message content, either plain text or HTML.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Unique identifier of the chat message to update.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: Format of the message content: 'text' or 'html'.

tools.name: MICROSOFT_TEAMS_UPDATE_TEAM
tools.description: Tool to update the properties of a team. Use when you need to modify team settings such as member, messaging, or fun settings.

inputSchema.title: UpdateTeamRequest

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The unique identifier (GUID) of the team to update.

funSettings.title: TeamFunSettings

giphyContentRating.title: Giphy Content Rating
giphyContentRating.description: The content rating for Giphy: 'strict' or 'moderate'.

funSettings.description: Settings that control fun features in the team.

memberSettings.title: TeamMemberSettings

allowCreateUpdateChannels.title: Allow Create Update Channels
allowCreateUpdateChannels.description: Whether members are allowed to create and update channels in the team.

memberSettings.description: Settings that control what members can do in the team.

messagingSettings.title: TeamMessagingSettings

allowUserEditMessages.title: Allow User Edit Messages
allowUserEditMessages.description: Whether users are allowed to edit their messages.

allowUserDeleteMessages.title: Allow User Delete Messages
allowUserDeleteMessages.description: Whether users are allowed to delete their messages.

messagingSettings.description: Settings that control messaging capabilities in the team.

inputSchema.description: Request payload to update properties of a Microsoft Teams team.
